headline: First Solar (FSLR) Surpasses Q2 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: First Solar (FSLR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +18.66% and +6.57%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Apple, Amazon, Coinbase: Stocks to Watch Afterhours
summary: ↘️ Amazon.com (AMZN): Shares fell about 6% postmarket after the ecommerce and cloud computing company reported sharp increases in sales and profit, but also showed a growth rate in its cloud business that wasn't as robust as some rivals'.

headline: First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) Beats Expectations in Strong Q2, Guides for Strong Full-Year Sales
summary: Solar panel manufacturer First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 8.6% year on year to $1.10 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $5.3 billion at the midpoint came in 4.4% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $3.18 per share was 19.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) Beats Expectations in Strong Q2, Guides for Strong Full-Year Sales
raw.summary: Solar panel manufacturer First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 8.6% year on year to $1.10 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $5.3 billion at the midpoint came in 4.4% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $3.18 per share was 19.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: First Solar raises annual sales outlook, expects higher prices due to tariffs
summary: The solar industry, which has grappled with lackluster demand and high interest rates, is now bracing for the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's policies related to renewable energy as well as his plans to impose tariffs on most imports.  While Trump's sweeping tax and spending bill - dubbed the "One Big, Beautiful Bill Act" (OBBBA) - aims to phase out solar and wind tax credits by 2028, the U.S. tariffs are expected to improve the outlook for solar companies.  "In our view, the recent policy and trade developments have, on balance, strengthened First Solar's relative position in the solar manufacturing industry," CEO Mark Widmar said.

raw.headline: First Solar raises annual sales outlook, expects higher prices due to tariffs

While Trump's sweeping tax and spending bill - dubbed the "One Big, Beautiful Bill Act" (OBBBA) - aims to phase out solar and wind tax credits by 2028, the U.S. tariffs are expected to improve the outlook for solar companies.  "In our view, the recent policy and trade developments have, on balance, strengthened First Solar's relative position in the solar manufacturing industry," CEO Mark Widmar said.

headline: First Solar Stock Earns Relative Strength Rating Lift

headline: First Solar: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.68 per share. The largest U.S. solar company posted revenue of $1.1 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts.

headline: This Week In Energy Transition - India's Renewable Energy Surge Powers National Growth
summary: India's energy landscape is undergoing a transformative shift, with a substantial increase in renewable energy capacity as a pivotal element. By 2030, India aims to achieve 500 GW of renewable energy capacity, which is projected to grow further to between 750-1000 GW by 2035. This growth is largely driven by the integration of renewable sources, such as wind and solar, supported by advanced energy storage systems and modernized grid infrastructure. Alongside this, substantial developments in...

headline: Mizuho Nudges First Solar Target to $278, Highlights Policy Edge Amid Solar Sector Shake-Up
summary: First Solar, Inc. (NASDAQ:FSLR) is one of the stocks that look extremely cheap on paper. On July 14, 2025, Mizuho Securities reiterated its Outperform rating on First Solar and nudged up its price target from $275 to $278, spotlighting the company as a standout beneficiary of U.S. clean‑energy policy despite broader headwinds.
